definition: to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
perspiration/sweat/CL:滴[di1],頭|头[tou2],身[shen1]/to be speechless (out of helplessness, embarrassment etc) (Internet slang used as an interjection)
see 可汗[ke4 han2], 汗國|汗国[han2 guo2]

sentences.english: Is there pain with your perspiration?
sentences.chinese: 當你流汗的時候覺得疼嗎？

sentences.english: Avoid activities that may make you sweaty sweety .
sentences.chinese: 避免進行會使得你流汗的活動。

sentences.english: Thick-lipped urns will sweat in the fragrant cellars.
sentences.chinese: 厚口的瓦罐會在芳香的地窖中流汗。

sentences.english: I am allergic to sweat and hard work it’s so ‘1985′.
sentences.chinese: 我討厭流汗，討厭辛苦工作，還是和1985年一樣。

sentences.english: You may need a glass of water as the sweat could dehydrate you.
sentences.chinese: 你可能需要一杯水，因爲流汗會帶走身體水分。

sentences.english: Dancing with music: turn on the music, then dance to its rhythm until I sweat.
sentences.chinese: 打開喜愛的音樂，聞歌起舞直到全身流汗。

sentences.english: This perspiration elimination human body la level therapy is very safe.
sentences.chinese: 這種流汗清除人體垃級療法很安全。

sentences.english: No equipment, just hustle and sweat.
sentences.chinese: 沒有設備，只是忙碌和流汗。

sentences.english: Predecessors are not afraid to blood, could their descendants be afraid to sweat?
sentences.chinese: 前人不怕多留血，後人哪怕多流汗？

sentences.english: Dont's want to cumber with my teacher.
sentences.chinese: 不願拖累老師獨自流汗。

sentences.english: We aren't a bit afraid of bleeding and sweating.
I'm sweating. I think my face actually twitches.
sentences.chinese: 我開始流汗，我想我的臉實際上正抽搐起來。

sentences.english: Our guys are still…and gals are still making sacrifices there.
sentences.chinese: 我軍男女將士仍在那裏流血流汗。

sentences.english: But if sit too close to the fire, I sweat.
sentences.chinese: 如果我離火太近，還會流汗的。

definition: to run/to jog/(military) to march at the double
sweating like rain (idiom); to perspire profusely/sweating like a pig
perspiration/sweat/CL:滴[di1],頭|头[tou2],身[shen1]/to be speechless (out of helplessness, embarrassment etc) (Internet slang used as an interjection)
see 可汗[ke4 han2], 汗國|汗国[han2 guo2]
to get wet in the rain
to collapse (from dehydration or loss of blood)/heat exhaustion
